par.text: Barium is a soft, silvery-white metal, a good conductor of heat and electricity. Barium and its compounds impart a greenish colouring to a flame. Barium is very reactive. It oxidises in air and has to be stored in kerosene. When heated, it burns to produce barium hydroxide Ba(OH)
. The water-soluble barium compounds are h
ighly poisonous. Barium was first obtained by
Humphry Davy in 1808. Its name is derived from the Greek word barys meaning ”heavy”.
